        Description #1 by hacky...@gmail.com (Aug 23, 2022)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by hacky...@gmail.com (Aug 23, 2022)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by hacky...@gmail.com (Aug 23, 2022)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by hacky...@gmail.com (Aug 23, 2022)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      Got this kasan with syzkaller, triggered on linux 5.19. chromeos is also affected.<span class="line"><!---->Got this kasan with syzkaller, triggered on linux 5.19. chromeos is also affected.<!----></span><br>hci_cmd_timeout is delayed work[1].So it can be run after hdev->sent_cmd  free[0].And then is dereferenced in [2]. This race condition is more difficult.<span class="line"><!---->hci_cmd_timeout is delayed work[1].So it can be run after hdev-&gt;sent_cmd  free[0].And then is dereferenced in [2]. This race condition is more difficult.<!----></span><br><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>-------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->-------------------------------<!----></span><br>INIT_DELAYED_WORK(&hdev->cmd_timer, hci_cmd_timeout); //[1]<span class="line"><!---->INIT_DELAYED_WORK(&amp;hdev-&gt;cmd_timer, hci_cmd_timeout); //[1]<!----></span><br><br><br><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/upstream/net/bluetooth/hci_core.c;l=1476<a class="undefined" target="_blank"         Not yet reported to the upstream bluetooth mailing list.I tested linux5.19, but the code upstream also has the same problem.There is currently no reproducer for this, because this race condition is a bit difficult, I use syzkaller fuzz. Attached is the details.<span class="line"><!---->Not yet reported to the upstream bluetooth mailing list.I tested linux5.19, but the code upstream also has the same problem.There is currently no reproducer for this, because this race condition is a bit difficult, I use syzkaller fuzz.         by

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1355718#c12">Comment 12<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Sep 6, 2022, 3:39 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        The problem quite obviously does exist in the ChromeOS kernel, at least in chromeos-5.15 (I didn't check older kernels). The cleanup code flushes cmd_work, but it does not cancel the timer which triggers the call to hci_cmd_timeout(). Worse, the matching close function doesn't do it either, and it releases hdev which may result in the timer pointer to be released while still running. <span class="line"><!---->The problem quite obviously does exist in the ChromeOS kernel, at least in chromeos-5.15 (I didn't check older kernels). The cleanup code flushes cmd_work, but it does not cancel the timer which triggers the call to hci_cmd_timeout(). Worse, the matching close function doesn't do it either, and it releases hdev which may result in the timer pointer to be released while still running. <!----></span><br><br>From various other syzcaller and crash reports, it is well known that the BT hci code is racy. Even if there are no immediate plans to address the specific problem reported here, I would recommend against closing this bug since it is a valid problem which does affect us and will at some point have to be fixed.<span class="line"><!---->From various other syzcaller and crash reports, it is well known that the BT hci code is racy. Even if there are no immediate plans to address the specific problem reported here, I would recommend against closing this bug since it is a valid problem which does affect us and will at some point have to be fixed.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2" commenterismember=""></mr-comment>

        apusaka: Uh oh! This issue still open and hasn't been updated in the last 28 days. This is a serious vulnerability, and we want to ensure that there's progress. Could you please leave an update with the current status and any potential blockers?<span class="line"><!---->apusaka: Uh oh! This issue still open and hasn't been updated in the last 28 days. Could you please leave an update with the current status and any potential blockers?<!----></span><br><br>If you're not the right owner for this issue, could you please remove yourself as soon as possible or help us find the right one?<span class="line"><!---->If you're not the right owner for this issue, could you please remove yourself as soon as possible or help us find the right one?<!----></span><br><br>If the issue is fixed or you can't reproduce it, please close the bug.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

            <div class="container-issue-content">
              <mr-issue-details class="main-item"><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background-color: var(--chops-white);
          padding-bottom: 1em;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          flex-direction: column;

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {

          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;

          width: 100%;

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }

    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;

    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }

    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;

      text-align: left;

          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>


      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

          <slot></slot>

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>


          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      Got this kasan with syzkaller, triggered on linux 5.19. chromeos is also affected.<span class="line"><!---->Got this kasan with syzkaller, triggered on linux 5.19. chromeos is also affected.<!----></span><br>hci_cmd_timeout is delayed work[1].So it can be run after hdev->sent_cmd  free[0].And then is dereferenced in [2]. This race condition is more difficult.<span class="line"><!---->hci_cmd_timeout is delayed work[1].So it can be run after hdev-&gt;sent_cmd  free[0].And then is dereferenced in [2]. This race condition is more difficult.<!----></span><br><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>-------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->-------------------------------<!----></span><br>INIT_DELAYED_WORK(&hdev->cmd_timer, hci_cmd_timeout); //[1]<span class="line"><!---->INIT_DELAYED_WORK(&amp;hdev-&gt;cmd_timer, hci_cmd_timeout); //[1]<!----></span><br><br><br><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/upstream/net/bluetooth/hci_core.c;l=1476<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/upstream/net/bluetooth/hci_core.c;l=1476"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/upstream/net/bluetooth/hci_core.c;l=1476<!----></a><br><br>static hci_dev *hdev = container_of(work, struct hci_dev,<span class="line"><!---->	struct hci_dev *hdev = container_of(work, struct hci_dev,<!----></span><br>					    cmd_timer.work);<span class="line"><!---->					    cmd_timer.work);<!----></span><br><br>	if (hdev->sent_cmd) {<span class="line"><!---->	if (hdev-&gt;sent_cmd) {<!----></span><br>		struct hci_command_hdr *sent = (void *) hdev->sent_cmd->data;   //[2]<span class="line"><!---->		struct hci_command_hdr *sent = (void *) hdev-&gt;sent_cmd-&gt;data;   //[2]<!----></span><br>		u16 opcode = __le16_to_cpu(sent->opcode);<span class="line"><!---->		u16 opcode = __le16_to_cpu(sent-&gt;opcode);<!----></span><br><br>		bt_dev_err(hdev, "command 0x%4.4x tx timeout", opcode);<span class="line"><!---->		bt_dev_err(hdev, "command 0x%4.4x tx timeout", opcode);<!----></span><br>	} else {<span class="line"><!---->	} else {<!----></span><br>		bt_dev_err(hdev, "command tx timeout");<span class="line"><!---->		bt_dev_err(hdev, "command tx timeout");<!----></span><br>	}<span class="line"><!---->	}<!----></span><br><br>	if (hdev->cmd_timeout)<span class="line"><!---->	if (hdev-&gt;cmd_timeout)<!----></span><br>		hdev->cmd_timeout(hdev);<span class="line"><!---->		hdev-&gt;cmd_timeout(hdev);<!----></span><br><br>	atomic_set(&hdev->cmd_cnt, 1);<span class="line"><!---->	atomic_set(&amp;hdev-&gt;cmd_cnt, 1);<!----></span><br>	queue_work(hdev->workqueue, &hdev->cmd_work);<span class="line"><!---->	queue_work(hdev-&gt;workqueue, &amp;hdev-&gt;cmd_work);<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/upstream/net/bluetooth/hci_sync.c;l=4075<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/upstream/net/bluetooth/hci_sync.c;l=4075"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/upstream/net/bluetooth/hci_sync.c;l=4075<!----></a><br><br>int hci_dev_open_sync(struct hci_dev *hdev)<span class="line"><!---->int hci_dev_open_sync(struct hci_dev *hdev)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>......<span class="line"><!---->......<!----></span><br>		/* Init failed, cleanup */<span class="line"><!---->		/* Init failed, cleanup */<!----></span><br>		flush_work(&hdev->tx_work);<span &hdev->flags);<span class="line"><!---->		clear_bit(HCI_RUNNING, &amp;hdev-&gt;flags);<!----></span><br>		hci_sock_dev_event(hdev, HCI_DEV_CLOSE);<span class="line"><!---->		hci_sock_dev_event(hdev, HCI_DEV_CLOSE);<!----></span><br>		hdev->close(hdev);<span class="line"><!---->		hdev-&gt;close(hdev);<!----></span><br>		hdev->flags &= BIT(HCI_RAW);<span class="line"><!---->		hdev-&gt;flags &amp;= BIT(HCI_RAW);<!----></span><br>	}<span class="line"><!---->	}<!----></span><br>done:<span class="line"><!---->done:<!----></span><br>	return ret;<span class="line"><!---->	return ret;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br><br>==================================================================<span           Comment 12<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1355718#c12">Comment 12<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="Last visit > 30 days ago" hidden="">schedule</i>
      groeck@chromium.org<a id="user-link" href="/u/2078421319" title="groeck@chromium.org"><!---->groeck@chromium.org<!----></a>
      groeck@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->groeck@chromium.org<!----></span>
      Last visit > 30 days ago<div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="Last visit > 30 days ago" hidden=""><!---->Last visit &gt; 30 days ago<!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Tue, Sep 6, 2022, 3:39 PM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Sep 6, 2022, 3:39 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          Project Member<span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1355718#c12">Comment 12<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Sep 6, 2022, 3:39 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1355718#c12">Comment 12<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Sep 6, 2022, 3:39 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        The problem quite obviously does exist in the ChromeOS kernel, at least in chromeos-5.15 (I didn't check older kernels). The cleanup code flushes cmd_work, but it does not cancel the timer which triggers the call to hci_cmd_timeout(). Worse, the matching close function doesn't do it either, and it releases hdev which may result in the timer pointer to be released while still running. <span class="line"><!---->The problem quite obviously does exist in the ChromeOS kernel, at least in chromeos-5.15 (I didn't check older kernels). The cleanup code flushes cmd_work, but it does not cancel the timer which triggers the call to hci_cmd_timeout(). Worse, the matching close function doesn't do it either, and it releases hdev which may result in the timer pointer to be released while still running. <!----></span><br><br>From various other syzcaller and crash reports, it is well known that the BT hci code is racy. Even if there are no immediate plans to address the specific problem reported here, I would recommend against closing this bug since it is a valid problem which does affect us and will at some point have to be fixed.<span class="line"><!---->From various other syzcaller and crash reports, it is well known that the BT hci code is racy. Even if there are no immediate plans to address the specific problem reported here, I would recommend against closing this bug since it is a valid problem which does affect us and will at some point have to be fixed.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2" commenterismember=""></mr-comment>

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1355718#c21">Comment 21<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      
        
          
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>

        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.

          border-collapse: collapse;

           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;

        for LitElement.

          <span>Blocked on issues</span>

      <chops-dialog closeonoutsideclick="">
        <h3 class="medium-heading">
          <span>Blocked on issues</span>
          <button aria-label="close">
            <i class="material-icons">close</i>
          </button>
        </h3>
        
        <table><tbody>
          <tr>
            
            <!---->
              <th><!---->Issue<!----></th>
            <!---->
              <th><!---->Summary<!----></th>
            <!---->
          </tr>

          
        </tbody></table>
      </chops-dialog>
    <mr-related-issues id="reorder-related-issues"></mr-related-issues>

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>

      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      Got this kasan with syzkaller, triggered on linux 5.19. chromeos is also affected.<span class="line"><!---->Got this kasan with syzkaller, triggered on linux 5.19. chromeos is also affected.<!----></span><br>hci_cmd_timeout is delayed work[1].So it can be run after hdev->sent_cmd  free[0].And then is dereferenced in [2]. This race condition is more difficult.<span class="line"><!---->hci_cmd_timeout is delayed work[1].So it can be run after hdev-&gt;sent_cmd  free[0].And then is dereferenced in [2]. This race condition is more difficult.<!----></span><br><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>-------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->-------------------------------<!----></span><br>INIT_DELAYED_WORK(&hdev->cmd_timer, hci_cmd_timeout); //[1]<span class="line"><!---->INIT_DELAYED_WORK(&amp;hdev-&gt;cmd_timer, hci_cmd_timeout); //[1]<!----></span><br><br><br><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/upstream/net/bluetooth/hci_core.c;l=1476<a &hdev->flags);<span class="line"><!---->		clear_bit(HCI_RUNNING, &amp;hdev-&gt;flags);<!----></span><br>		hci_sock_dev_event(hdev, HCI_DEV_CLOSE);<span class="line"><!---->		hci_sock_dev_event(hdev,         by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="Last visit > 30 days ago" hidden="">schedule</i>

      groeck@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->groeck@chromium.org<!----></span>
      Last visit > 30 days ago<div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="Last visit > 30 days ago" hidden=""><!---->Last visit &gt; 30 days ago<!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Tue, Sep 6, 2022, 3:39 PM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Sep 6, 2022, 3:39 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          Project Member<span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1355718#c12">Comment 12<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Sep 6, 2022, 3:39 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1355718#c12">Comment 12<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Sep 6, 2022, 3:39 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        The problem quite obviously does exist in the ChromeOS kernel, at least in chromeos-5.15 (I didn't check older kernels). The cleanup code flushes cmd_work, but it does not cancel the timer which triggers the call to hci_cmd_timeout(). Worse, the matching close function doesn't do it either, and it releases hdev which may result in the timer pointer to be released while still running. <span class="line"><!---->The problem quite obviously does exist in the ChromeOS kernel, at least in chromeos-5.15 (I didn't check older kernels). The cleanup code flushes cmd_work, but it does not cancel the timer which triggers the call to hci_cmd_timeout(). Worse, the matching close function doesn't do it either, and it releases hdev which may result in the timer pointer to be released while still running. <!----></span><br><br>From various other syzcaller and crash reports, it is well known that the BT hci code is racy. Even if there are no immediate plans to address the specific problem reported here, I would recommend against closing this bug since it is a valid problem which does affect us and will at some point have to be fixed.<span class="line"><!---->From various other syzcaller and crash reports, it is well known that the BT hci code is racy. Even if there are no immediate plans to address the specific problem reported here, I would recommend against closing this bug since it is a valid problem which does affect us and will at some point have to be fixed.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2" commenterismember=""></mr-comment>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

        <slot></slot>
      </label>

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }

          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }

            width: 100%;

          }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      Got this kasan with syzkaller, triggered on linux 5.19. chromeos is also affected.<span class="line"><!---->Got this kasan with syzkaller, triggered on linux 5.19. chromeos is also affected.<!----></span><br>hci_cmd_timeout is delayed work[1].So it can be run after hdev->sent_cmd  free[0].And then is dereferenced in [2]. This race condition is more difficult.<span class="line"><!---->hci_cmd_timeout is delayed work[1].So it can be run after hdev-&gt;sent_cmd  free[0].And then is dereferenced in [2]. This race condition is more difficult.<!----></span><br><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>-------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->-------------------------------<!----></span><br>INIT_DELAYED_WORK(&hdev->cmd_timer, hci_cmd_timeout); //[1]<span class="line"><!---->INIT_DELAYED_WORK(&amp;hdev-&gt;cmd_timer, hci_cmd_timeout); //[1]<!----></span><br><br><br><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/upstream/net/bluetooth/hci_core.c;l=1476<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/upstream/net/bluetooth/hci_core.c;l=1476"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/upstream/net/bluetooth/hci_core.c;l=1476<!----></a><br><br>static void hci_cmd_timeout(struct work_struct *work)<span class="line"><!---->static void hci_cmd_timeout(struct work_struct *work)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>	struct hci_dev *hdev = container_of(work, struct hci_dev,<span class="line"><!---->	struct hci_dev *hdev = container_of(work, struct hci_dev,<!----></span><br>					    cmd_timer.work);<span class="line"><!---->					    cmd_timer.work);<!----></span><br><br>	if (hdev->sent_cmd) {<span class="line"><!---->	if (hdev-&gt;sent_cmd) {<!----></span><br>		struct hci_command_hdr *sent = (void *) hdev->sent_cmd->data;   //[2]<span class="line"><!---->		struct hci_command_hdr *sent = (void *) hdev-&gt;sent_cmd-&gt;data;   //[2]<!----></span><br>		u16 opcode = __le16_to_cpu(sent->opcode);<span class="line"><!---->		u16 opcode = __le16_to_cpu(sent-&gt;opcode);<!----></span><br><br>		bt_dev_err(hdev, "command 0x%4.4x tx timeout", opcode);<span class="line"><!---->		bt_dev_err(hdev, "command 0x%4.4x tx timeout", opcode);<!----></span><br>	} else {<span class="line"><!---->	} else {<!----></span><br>		bt_dev_err(hdev, "command tx timeout");<span class="line"><!---->		bt_dev_err(hdev, "command tx timeout");<!----></span><br>	}<span class="line"><!---->	}<!----></span><br><br>	if (hdev->cmd_timeout)<span class="line"><!---->	if (hdev-&gt;cmd_timeout)<!----></span><br>		hdev->cmd_timeout(hdev);<span class="line"><!---->		hdev-&gt;cmd_timeout(hdev);<!----></span><br><br>	atomic_set(&hdev->cmd_cnt, 1);<span class="line"><!---->	atomic_set(&amp;hdev-&gt;cmd_cnt, 1);<!----></span><br>	queue_work(hdev->workqueue, &hdev->cmd_work);<span class="line"><!---->	queue_work(hdev-&gt;workqueue, &amp;hdev-&gt;cmd_work);<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/upstream/net/bluetooth/hci_sync.c;l=4075<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/upstream/net/bluetooth/hci_sync.c;l=4075"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/upstream/net/bluetooth/hci_sync.c;l=4075<!----></a><br><br>int hci_dev_open_sync(struct hci_dev *hdev)<span class="line"><!---->int hci_dev_open_sync(struct hci_dev *hdev)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>......<span class="line"><!---->......<!----></span><br>		/* Init failed, cleanup */<span class="line"><!---->		/* Init failed, cleanup */<!----></span><br>		flush_work(&hdev->tx_work);<span class="line"><!---->		flush_work(&amp;hdev-&gt;tx_work);<!----></span><br>		/* Since hci_rx_work() is possible to awake new cmd_work<span class="line"><!---->		/* Since hci_rx_work() is possible to awake new cmd_work<!----></span><br>		 * it should be flushed first to avoid unexpected call of<span class="line"><!---->		 * it should be flushed first to avoid unexpected call of<!----></span><br>		 * hci_cmd_work()<span class="line"><!---->		 * hci_cmd_work()<!----></span><br>		 */<span class="line"><!---->		 */<!----></span><br>		flush_work(&hdev->rx_work);<span class="line"><!---->		flush_work(&amp;hdev-&gt;rx_work);<!----></span><br>		flush_work(&hdev->cmd_work);<span class="line"><!---->		skb_queue_purge(&amp;hdev-&gt;cmd_q);<!----></span><br>		skb_queue_purge(&hdev->rx_q);<span class="line"><!---->		skb_queue_purge(&amp;hdev-&gt;rx_q);<!----></span><br>		if (hdev->flush)<span class="line"><!---->		if (hdev-&gt;flush)<!----></span><br>			hdev->flush(hdev);<span class="line"><!---->			hdev-&gt;flush(hdev);<!----></span><br>		if (hdev->sent_cmd) {<span class="line"><!---->		if (hdev-&gt;sent_cmd) {<!----></span><br>			kfree_skb(hdev->sent_cmd);    //[0]<span class="line"><!---->			kfree_skb(hdev-&gt;sent_cmd);    //[0]<!----></span><br>			hdev->sent_cmd = NULL;<span class="line"><!---->			hdev-&gt;sent_cmd = NULL;<!----></span><br>		}<span class="line"><!---->		}<!----></span><br>		clear_bit(HCI_RUNNING, &hdev->flags);<span class="line"><!---->		clear_bit(HCI_RUNNING, &amp;hdev-&gt;flags);<!----></span><br>		hci_sock_dev_event(hdev, HCI_DEV_CLOSE);<span class="line"><!---->		hci_sock_dev_event(hdev, HCI_DEV_CLOSE);<!----></span><br>		hdev->close(hdev);<span class="line"><!---->		hdev-&gt;close(hdev);<!----></span><br>		hdev->flags &= BIT(HCI_RAW);<span class="line"><!---->		hdev-&gt;flags &amp;= BIT(HCI_RAW);<!----></span><br>	}<span class="line"><!---->	}<!----></span><br>done:<span class="line"><!---->done:<!----></span><br>	return ret;<span class="line"><!---->	return ret;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br><br>==================================================================<span class="line"><!---->==================================================================<!----></span><br>BUG: KASAN: use-after-free in hci_cmd_timeout+0x239/0x250 net/bluetooth/hci_core.c:1474<span class="line"><!---->BUG: KASAN: use-after-free in hci_cmd_timeout+0x239/0x250 net/bluetooth/hci_core.c:1474<!----></span><br>Read of size 8 at addr ffff88806e414d58 by task kworker/0:3/2993<span class="line"><!---->Read of size 8 at addr ffff88806e414d58 by task kworker/0:3/2993<!----></span><br><br>CPU: 0 PID: 2993 Comm: kworker/0:3 Not tainted 5.19.0 #1<span class="line"><!---->CPU: 0 PID: 2993 Comm: kworker/0:3 Not tainted 5.19.0 #1<!----></span><br>Hardware name: QEMU Standard PC (i440FX + PIIX, 1996), BIOS 1.13.0-1ubuntu1.1 04/01/2014<span class="line"><!---->Hardware name: QEMU Standard PC (i440FX + PIIX, 1996), BIOS 1.13.0-1ubuntu1.1 04/01/2014<!----></span><br>Workqueue: events hci_cmd_timeout<span class="line"><!---->Workqueue: events hci_cmd_timeout<!----></span><br>Call Trace:<span class="line"><!---->Call Trace:<!----></span><br> <TASK><span class="line"><!----> &lt;TASK&gt;<!----></span><br> __dump_stack lib/dump_stack.c:88 [inline]<span class="line"><!---->       <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1355718#c12">Comment 12<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Sep 6, 2022, 3:39 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>

      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        The problem quite obviously does exist in the ChromeOS kernel, at least in chromeos-5.15 (I didn't check older kernels). The cleanup code flushes cmd_work, but it does not cancel the timer which triggers the call to hci_cmd_timeout(). Worse, the matching close function doesn't do it either, and it releases hdev which may result in the timer pointer to be released while still running. <span class="line"><!---->The problem quite obviously does exist in the ChromeOS kernel, at least in chromeos-5.15 (I didn't check older kernels). The cleanup code flushes cmd_work, but it does not cancel the timer which triggers the call to hci_cmd_timeout(). Worse, the matching close function doesn't do it either, and it releases hdev which may result in the timer pointer to be released while still running. <!----></span><br><br>From various other syzcaller and crash reports, it is well known that the BT hci code is racy. Even if there are no immediate plans to address the specific problem reported here, I would recommend against closing this bug since it is a valid problem which does affect us and will at some point have to be fixed.<span class="line"><!---->From various other syzcaller and crash reports, it is well known that the BT hci code is racy. Even if there are no immediate plans to address the specific problem reported here, I would recommend against closing this bug since it is a valid problem which does affect us and will at some point have to be fixed.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2" commenterismember=""></mr-comment>
