        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      Got this kasan with syzkaller, triggered on linux 5.19. chromeos is also affected.<span class="line"><!---->Got this kasan with syzkaller, triggered on linux 5.19. chromeos is also affected.<!----></span><br>hci_cmd_timeout is delayed work[1].So it can be run after hdev->sent_cmd  free[0].And then is dereferenced in [2]. This race condition is more difficult.<span class="line"><!---->hci_cmd_timeout is delayed work[1].So it can be run after hdev-&gt;sent_cmd  free[0].And then is dereferenced in [2]. This race condition is more difficult.<!----></span><br><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>-------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->-------------------------------<!----></span><br>INIT_DELAYED_WORK(&hdev->cmd_timer, hci_cmd_timeout); //[1]<span class="line"><!---->INIT_DELAYED_WORK(&amp;hdev-&gt;cmd_timer, hci_cmd_timeout); //[1]<!----></span><br><br><br><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/upstream/net/bluetooth/hci_core.c;l=1476<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/upstream/net/bluetooth/hci_core.c;l=1476"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/upstream/net/bluetooth/hci_core.c;l=1476<!----></a><br><br>static void hci_cmd_timeout(struct work_struct *work)<span class="line"><!---->static void hci_cmd_timeout(struct work_struct *work)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>	struct hci_dev *hdev = container_of(work, struct hci_dev,<span class="line"><!---->	struct hci_dev *hdev = container_of(work, struct hci_dev,<!----></span><br>					    cmd_timer.work);<span class="line"><!---->					    cmd_timer.work);<!----></span><br><br>	if (hdev->sent_cmd) {<span class="line"><!---->	if (hdev-&gt;sent_cmd) {<!----></span><br>		struct hci_command_hdr *sent = (void *) hdev->sent_cmd->data;   //[2]<span class="line"><!---->		struct hci_command_hdr *sent = (void *) hdev-&gt;sent_cmd-&gt;data;   //[2]<!----></span><br>		u16 opcode = __le16_to_cpu(sent->opcode);<span class="line"><!---->		u16 opcode = __le16_to_cpu(sent-&gt;opcode);<!----></span><br><br>		bt_dev_err(hdev, "command 0x%4.4x tx timeout", opcode);<span class="line"><!---->		bt_dev_err(hdev, "command 0x%4.4x tx timeout", opcode);<!----></span><br>	} else {<span class="line"><!---->	} else {<!----></span><br>		bt_dev_err(hdev, "command tx timeout");<span class="line"><!---->		bt_dev_err(hdev, "command tx timeout");<!----></span><br>	}<span class="line"><!---->	}<!----></span><br><br>	if (hdev->cmd_timeout)<span class="line"><!---->	if (hdev-&gt;cmd_timeout)<!----></span><br>		hdev->cmd_timeout(hdev);<span class="line"><!---->		hdev-&gt;cmd_timeout(hdev);<!----></span><br><br>	atomic_set(&hdev->cmd_cnt, 1);<span class="line"><!---->	atomic_set(&amp;hdev-&gt;cmd_cnt, 1);<!----></span><br>	queue_work(hdev->workqueue, &hdev->cmd_work);<span class="line"><!---->	queue_work(hdev-&gt;workqueue, &amp;hdev-&gt;cmd_work);<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/upstream/net/bluetooth/hci_sync.c;l=4075<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/upstream/net/bluetooth/hci_sync.c;l=4075"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/upstream/net/bluetooth/hci_sync.c;l=4075<!----></a><br><br>int hci_dev_open_sync(struct hci_dev *hdev)<span class="line"><!---->int hci_dev_open_sync(struct hci_dev *hdev)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>......<span class="line"><!---->......<!----></span><br>		/* Init failed, cleanup */<span class="line"><!---->		/* Init failed, cleanup */<!----></span><br>		flush_work(&hdev->tx_work);<span class="line"><!---->		flush_work(&amp;hdev-&gt;tx_work);<!----></span><br>		/* Since hci_rx_work() is possible to awake new cmd_work<span class="line"><!---->		/* Since hci_rx_work() is possible to awake new cmd_work<!----></span><br>		 * it should be flushed first to avoid unexpected call of<span class="line"><!---->		 * it should be flushed first to avoid unexpected call of<!----></span><br>		 * hci_cmd_work()<span class="line"><!---->		 * hci_cmd_work()<!----></span><br>		 */<span class="line"><!---->		 */<!----></span><br>		flush_work(&hdev->rx_work);<span class="line"><!---->		flush_work(&amp;hdev-&gt;rx_work);<!----></span><br>		flush_work(&hdev->cmd_work);<span class="line"><!---->		flush_work(&amp;hdev-&gt;cmd_work);<!----></span><br>		skb_queue_purge(&hdev->cmd_q);<span class="line"><!---->		skb_queue_purge(&amp;hdev-&gt;cmd_q);<!----></span><br>		skb_queue_purge(&hdev->rx_q);<span class="line"><!---->		skb_queue_purge(&amp;hdev-&gt;rx_q);<!----></span><br>		if (hdev->flush)<span class="line"><!---->		if (hdev-&gt;flush)<!----></span><br>			hdev->flush(hdev);<span class="line"><!---->			hdev-&gt;flush(hdev);<!----></span><br>		if (hdev->sent_cmd) {<span class="line"><!---->		if (hdev-&gt;sent_cmd) {<!----></span><br>			kfree_skb(hdev->sent_cmd);    //[0]<span class="line"><!---->			kfree_skb(hdev-&gt;sent_cmd);    //[0]<!----></span><br>			hdev->sent_cmd = NULL;<span class="line"><!---->			hdev-&gt;sent_cmd = NULL;<!----></span><br>		}<span class="line"><!---->		}<!----></span><br>		clear_bit(HCI_RUNNING, &hdev->flags);<span class="line"><!---->		clear_bit(HCI_RUNNING, &amp;hdev-&gt;flags);<!----></span><br>		hci_sock_dev_event(hdev, HCI_DEV_CLOSE);<span class="line"><!---->		hci_sock_dev_event(hdev, HCI_DEV_CLOSE);<!----></span><br>		hdev->close(hdev);<span class="line"><!---->		hdev-&gt;close(hdev);<!----></span><br>		hdev->flags &= BIT(HCI_RAW);<span class="line"><!---->		hdev-&gt;flags &amp;= BIT(HCI_RAW);<!----></span><br>	}<span class="line"><!---->	}<!----></span><br>done:<span class="line"><!---->done:<!----></span><br>	return ret;<span class="line"><!---->	return ret;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br><br>==================================================================<span class="line"><!---->==================================================================<!----></span><br>BUG: KASAN: use-after-free in hci_cmd_timeout+0x239/0x250 net/bluetooth/hci_core.c:1474<span class="line"><!---->BUG: KASAN: use-after-free in hci_cmd_timeout+0x239/0x250 net/bluetooth/hci_core.c:1474<!----></span><br>Read of size 8 at addr ffff88806e414d58 by task kworker/0:3/2993<span class="line"><!---->Read of size 8 at addr ffff88806e414d58 by task kworker/0:3/2993<!----></span><br><br>CPU: 0 PID: 2993 Comm: kworker/0:3 Not tainted 5.19.0 #1<span class="line"><!---->CPU: 0 PID: 2993 Comm: kworker/0:3 Not tainted 5.19.0 #1<!----></span><br>Hardware name: QEMU Standard PC (i440FX + PIIX, 1996), BIOS 1.13.0-1ubuntu1.1 04/01/2014<span class="line"><!---->Hardware name: QEMU           <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1355718#c12">Comment 12<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Sep 6, 2022, 3:39 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

        The problem quite obviously does exist in the ChromeOS kernel, at least in chromeos-5.15 (I didn't check older kernels). The cleanup code flushes cmd_work, but it does not cancel the timer which triggers the call to hci_cmd_timeout(). Worse, the matching close function doesn't do it either, and it releases hdev which may result in the timer pointer to be released while still running. <span class="line"><!---->The problem quite obviously does exist in the ChromeOS kernel, at least in chromeos-5.15 (I didn't check older kernels). The cleanup code flushes cmd_work, but it does not cancel the timer which triggers the call to hci_cmd_timeout(). Worse, the matching close function doesn't do it either, and it releases hdev which may result in the timer pointer to be released while still running. <!----></span><br><br>From various other syzcaller and crash reports, it is well known that the BT hci code is racy. Even if there are no immediate plans to address the specific problem reported here, I would recommend against closing this bug since it is a valid problem which does affect us and will at some point have to be fixed.<span class="line"><!---->From various other syzcaller and crash reports, it is well known that the BT hci code is racy. Even if there are no immediate plans to address the specific problem reported here, I would recommend against closing this bug since it is a valid problem which does affect us and will at some point have to be fixed.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2" commenterismember=""></mr-comment>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

            Issue 1355718: Security: UAF in hci_cmd_timeout 
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1355718: Security: UAF in hci_cmd_timeout 
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

      Got this kasan with syzkaller, triggered on linux 5.19. chromeos is also affected.<span class="line"><!---->Got this kasan with syzkaller, triggered on linux 5.19. chromeos is also affected.<!----></span><br>hci_cmd_timeout is delayed work[1].So it can be run after hdev->sent_cmd  free[0].And then is dereferenced in [2]. This race condition is more difficult.<span class="line"><!---->hci_cmd_timeout is delayed work[1].So it can be run after hdev-&gt;sent_cmd  free[0].And then is dereferenced in [2]. This race condition is more difficult.<!----></span><br><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>-------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->-------------------------------<!----></span><br>INIT_DELAYED_WORK(&hdev->cmd_timer, hci_cmd_timeout); //[1]<span class="line"><!---->INIT_DELAYED_WORK(&amp;hdev-&gt;cmd_timer, hci_cmd_timeout); //[1]<!----></span><br><br><br><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/upstream/net/bluetooth/hci_core.c;l=1476<a &hdev->flags);<span class="line"><!---->		clear_bit(HCI_RUNNING, &amp;hdev-&gt;flags);<!----></span><br>		hci_sock_dev_event(hdev, HCI_DEV_CLOSE);<span class="line"><!---->		hci_sock_dev_event(hdev,           Comment 6<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1355718#c6">Comment 6<!----></a>

          Comment 12<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1355718#c12">Comment 12<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="Last visit > 30 days ago" hidden="">schedule</i>
      groeck@chromium.org<a id="user-link" href="/u/2078421319" title="groeck@chromium.org"><!---->groeck@chromium.org<!----></a>
      groeck@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->groeck@chromium.org<!----></span>
      Last visit > 30 days ago<div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="Last visit > 30 days ago" hidden=""><!---->Last visit &gt; 30 days ago<!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Tue, Sep 6, 2022, 3:39 PM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Sep 6, 2022, 3:39 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          Project Member<span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1355718#c12">Comment 12<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Sep 6, 2022, 3:39 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1355718#c12">Comment 12<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Sep 6, 2022, 3:39 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        The problem quite obviously does exist in the ChromeOS kernel, at least in chromeos-5.15 (I didn't check older kernels). The cleanup code flushes cmd_work, but it does not cancel the timer which triggers the call to hci_cmd_timeout(). Worse, the matching close function doesn't do it either, and it releases hdev which may result in the timer pointer to be released while still running. <span class="line"><!---->The problem quite obviously does exist in the ChromeOS kernel, at least in chromeos-5.15 (I didn't check older kernels). The cleanup code flushes cmd_work, but it does not cancel the timer which triggers the call to hci_cmd_timeout(). Worse, the matching close function doesn't do it either, and it releases hdev which may result in the timer pointer to be released while still running. <!----></span><br><br>From various other syzcaller and crash reports, it is well known that the BT hci code is racy. Even if there are no immediate plans to address the specific problem reported here, I would recommend against closing this bug since it is a valid problem which does affect us and will at some point have to be fixed.<span class="line"><!---->From various other syzcaller and crash reports, it is well known that the BT hci code is racy. Even if there are no immediate plans to address the specific problem reported here, I would recommend against closing this bug since it is a valid problem which does affect us and will at some point have to be fixed.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2" commenterismember=""></mr-comment>

well.<!----></span><br><br>Signed-off-by: Archie Pusaka <<span class="line"><!---->Signed-off-by: Archie Pusaka &lt;<!----></span>apusaka@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank"         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.       Got this kasan with syzkaller, triggered on linux 5.19. chromeos is also affected.<span class="line"><!---->Got this kasan with syzkaller, triggered on linux 5.19. chromeos is also affected.<!----></span><br>hci_cmd_timeout is delayed work[1].So it can be run after hdev->sent_cmd  free[0].And then is dereferenced in [2]. This race condition is more difficult.<span class="line"><!---->hci_cmd_timeout is delayed work[1].So it can be run after hdev-&gt;sent_cmd  free[0].And then is dereferenced in [2]. This race condition is more difficult.<!----></span><br><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>-------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->-------------------------------<!----></span><br>INIT_DELAYED_WORK(&hdev->cmd_timer, hci_cmd_timeout); //[1]<span class="line"><!---->INIT_DELAYED_WORK(&amp;hdev-&gt;cmd_timer, hci_cmd_timeout); //[1]<!----></span><br><br><br><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/upstream/net/bluetooth/hci_core.c;l=1476<a class="undefined" target="_blank" "command tx timeout");<!----></span><br>	}<span class="line"><!---->	}<!----></span><br><br>	if (hdev->cmd_timeout)<span class="line"><!---->	if &amp;hdev-&gt;cmd_work);<!----></span><br>}<span &hdev->flags);<span class="line"><!---->		clear_bit(HCI_RUNNING, &amp;hdev-&gt;flags);<!----></span><br>		hci_sock_dev_event(hdev, HCI_DEV_CLOSE);<span class="line"><!---->		hci_sock_dev_event(hdev,           Comment 12<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1355718#c12">Comment 12<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="Last visit > 30 days ago" hidden="">schedule</i>
      groeck@chromium.org<a id="user-link" href="/u/2078421319" title="groeck@chromium.org"><!---->groeck@chromium.org<!----></a>
      groeck@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->groeck@chromium.org<!----></span>
      Last visit > 30 days ago<div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="Last visit > 30 days ago" hidden=""><!---->Last visit &gt; 30 days ago<!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Tue, Sep 6, 2022, 3:39 PM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Sep 6, 2022, 3:39 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          Project Member<span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1355718#c12">Comment 12<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Sep 6, 2022, 3:39 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1355718#c12">Comment 12<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Sep 6, 2022, 3:39 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        The problem quite obviously does exist in the ChromeOS kernel, at least in chromeos-5.15 (I didn't check older kernels). The cleanup code flushes cmd_work, but it does not cancel the timer which triggers the call to hci_cmd_timeout(). Worse, the matching close function doesn't do it either, and it releases hdev which may result in the timer pointer to be released while still running. <span class="line"><!---->The problem quite obviously does exist in the ChromeOS kernel, at least in chromeos-5.15 (I didn't check older kernels). The cleanup code flushes cmd_work, but it does not cancel the timer which triggers the call to hci_cmd_timeout(). Worse, the matching close function doesn't do it either, and it releases hdev which may result in the timer pointer to be released while still running. <!----></span><br><br>From various other syzcaller and crash reports, it is well known that the BT hci code is racy. Even if there are no immediate plans to address the specific problem reported here, I would recommend against closing this bug since it is a valid problem which does affect us and will at some point have to be fixed.<span class="line"><!---->From various other syzcaller and crash reports, it is well known that the BT hci code is racy. Even if there are no immediate plans to address the specific problem reported here, I would recommend against closing this bug since it is a valid problem which does affect us and will at some point have to be fixed.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2" commenterismember=""></mr-comment>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Congratulations! The VRP Panel has decided to award you $15,000 for this report. Nice finding! Thank you for your efforts and reporting this issue to us!<span class="line"><!---->Congratulations! The VRP Panel has decided to award you $15,000 for this report. Nice finding! Thank you for your efforts and reporting this issue to us!<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      Got this kasan with syzkaller, triggered on linux 5.19. chromeos is also affected.<span class="line"><!---->Got this kasan with syzkaller, triggered on linux 5.19. chromeos is also affected.<!----></span><br>hci_cmd_timeout is delayed work[1].So it can be run after hdev->sent_cmd  free[0].And then is dereferenced in [2]. This race condition is more difficult.<span class="line"><!---->hci_cmd_timeout is delayed work[1].So it can be run after hdev-&gt;sent_cmd  free[0].And then is dereferenced in [2]. This race condition is more difficult.<!----></span><br><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>-------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->-------------------------------<!----></span><br>INIT_DELAYED_WORK(&hdev->cmd_timer, hci_cmd_timeout); //[1]<span class="line"><!---->INIT_DELAYED_WORK(&amp;hdev-&gt;cmd_timer, &amp;hdev-&gt;cmd_work);<!----></span><br>}<span &hdev->flags);<span class="line"><!---->		clear_bit(HCI_RUNNING, &amp;hdev-&gt;flags);<!----></span><br>		hci_sock_dev_event(hdev, HCI_DEV_CLOSE);<span class="line"><!---->		hci_sock_dev_event(hdev,           Comment 12<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1355718#c12">Comment 12<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="Last visit > 30 days ago" hidden="">schedule</i>
      groeck@chromium.org<a id="user-link" href="/u/2078421319" title="groeck@chromium.org"><!---->groeck@chromium.org<!----></a>
      groeck@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->groeck@chromium.org<!----></span>
      Last visit > 30 days ago<div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="Last visit > 30 days ago" hidden=""><!---->Last visit &gt; 30 days ago<!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Tue, Sep 6, 2022, 3:39 PM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Sep 6, 2022, 3:39 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          Project Member<span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1355718#c12">Comment 12<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Sep 6, 2022, 3:39 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1355718#c12">Comment 12<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Sep 6, 2022, 3:39 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        The problem quite obviously does exist in the ChromeOS kernel, at least in chromeos-5.15 (I didn't check older kernels). The cleanup code flushes cmd_work, but it does not cancel the timer which triggers the call to hci_cmd_timeout(). Worse, the matching close function doesn't do it either, and it releases hdev which may result in the timer pointer to be released while still running. <span class="line"><!---->The problem quite obviously does exist in the ChromeOS kernel, at least in chromeos-5.15 (I didn't check older kernels). The cleanup code flushes cmd_work, but it does not cancel the timer which triggers the call to hci_cmd_timeout(). Worse, the matching close function doesn't do it either, and it releases hdev which may result in the timer pointer to be released while still running. <!----></span><br><br>From various other syzcaller and crash reports, it is well known that the BT hci code is racy. Even if there are no immediate plans to address the specific problem reported here, I would recommend against closing this bug since it is a valid problem which does affect us and will at some point have to be fixed.<span class="line"><!---->From various other syzcaller and crash reports, it is well known that the BT hci code is racy. Even if there are no immediate plans to address the specific problem reported here, I would recommend against closing this bug since it is a valid problem which does affect us and will at some point have to be fixed.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

          <div class="input-grid">
            <label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

         * is disabled for this component.

           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */

        for LitElement.

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
